name: Novotel London Blackfriars

reviews.title: Nice new hotel with good gym
reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights and was impressed at the thought that has gone into this new hotel. The rooms are well equipped and set up to make best use of the space.
Odd glass wall to separate the bathroom and bedroom and would make me think twice about sharing with a friend
reviews.title: Well located, modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took a trip to the gym which was well equipped for a hotel.
reviews.title: New hotel, fantastic customer service

reviews.text: This is a great hotel for a city break stay. It is shiny and new, spotlessly clean, well designed and caters to both family and business travellers. It is well located, less than a minute from the Jubilee line (Southwark) and has all the facilities one would expect with a few special touches. Free wifi is always appreciated, communal printers and ipads on some of the breakfast tables are examples.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: We had no problem with checking in or out using the automated system so they seem to have resolved whatever issues may have previously existed there. Have had to wait much longer in other London hotels.
reviews.title: Unique, high-tec hotel. This is the future of Novotel brand

reviews.text: I came with my sister and five year old niece and this hotel was perfect for our needs. Staff were friendly and very pleasant to children which is a nice thing to see. The buffet breakfast was plentiful and varied. The pool was lovely and we had it to ourselves for half an hour on the Sunday morning which was a special treat. Computer consoles in the lobby were a big hit with my niece and we found provided an opportunity for children of a variety of nationalities to play together.
reviews.title: Great hotel and very new

reviews.text: The only fault was that room service food was a bit overpriced in relation to the portion sizes. It also arrived uncovered and therefore a bit on the cool side - however we ate it anyway so it can't have been that bad!
reviews.title: Perfect for the solo traveller

reviews.text: Just a quickie for Tim : I agree entirely with your point re the transparent wall between the toilet and the bedroom but their is a buttton which turns it opaque (you wouldn't know in fairness unless you asked)
reviews.title: Great New VFM Hotel

reviews.text: An excellent new Hotel which manages to combine good quality with reasonable prices (why do the French understand this more than Premier Inn ?) This Hotel opened in October 2012 and still has a new feel about it. It is wonderfully located just a short walk from the Thames and Central London. What makes this Hotel so good is the quality of the staff. They are without exception, fabulous : positive helpful and very polite (can they really all be French !) Not sure I should recommend this Hotel as it will make it harder to get in next time I am in London. Family of 7 had 4 rooms over two nights over New Years Eve. Could not have picked a better Hotel for the price !
reviews.title: Novotel Blackfriars

reviews.text: We stayed as a family of four (2 adults, 2 children aged 8 and 11) in one large room with four very comfortable beds. Lots of room, very well appointed, including tea-making equipments. Excellent TV. One slight gripe - the transparent wall between bedroom and bathroom means that the toilet is exposed to view, which not everyone appreciated. This is an excellent hotel, comfortable, bright, clean, welcoming, efficient, very nice staff. The swimming pool is a big plus. Location could hardly be better - just a few yards from Southwark Tube Station on the Jubilee line means that the West End can be reached very quickly. Also ideal for visiting Greenwich, Cutty Sark etc. Excellent restaurant and fabulous breakfast buffet. By booking online in advance we also got a very good rate. Altogether a five-star experience in every respect. We shall certainly go again. The best hotel I have stayed in in London.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: New, clean and bright. Despite being south of the river, it's a couple of minutes walk to the tube. The rooms a well lit (so many hotels seem to think dim is what customer want) and airy. Would recommend for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: High recommended but...

reviews.text: Great hotel. Great location. The rooms are big and comfortable. Very clean. The restaurant inside the hotel is very good. Lovable buffet. Absolutely fantastic location. Only 5 minutes far from bond st (by tube).
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here three nights in October.
reviews.title: Really good choice for London.

reviews.text: A very new hotel in an excellent location; you can walk to the Thames in under 10 minutes and from there you have many of the sights of London at your feet. A few minutes in the other direction brings you to Southwalk tube station (around which there are eateries, pubs and supermarkets. All very convenient. Even saw Boris cycling around the area.
reviews.title: Excellent facilities and close proximinity to centre of London

reviews.text: The hotel rooms are well appointed, clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast in the lobby was superb. Free wifi throughout is a real plus; why does Accor not make this standard across all its hotels?
reviews.title: Fabulous new property

reviews.text: As the hotel was brand new when we stayed we experienced teething troubles. Our room safe would not open after we had deposited our valuables. Fortunately, this was not critical for us and the staff worked hard to solve the problem; one chap even came from home at 8pm, another was late going off duty. All very commendable. It still took over 12 hours to open the safe, which proves at least, that it is very secure; two blokes with drills and a book of instructions found it difficult! The hotel offered compensation in the form of breakfasts and handled the incident well.
reviews.title: New Years evening stay in London

reviews.text: Overall, a really good choice for London.
reviews.title: Good choice for business stay in London

description: The cultural epicentre of London has a brand new attraction: a beautifully designed contemporary hotel that arts-lovers and tech-heads alike will welcome. Book a room here and you’ll be in the capital’s latest centre of mustsee theatre, art, music and restaurants, while guaranteeing a stay experience you’ll remember forever. Welcome to Novotel London Blackfriars.
